Html:
Getting a strange set of values on the chest upgrade list for my Disc Priest.

Blanketing Robes of Snow: 32.05
Conqueror's Raiments of Sanctification: 43.15
Conqueror's Robe of Sanctification: 181.23
Heroes' Robe of Faith: 1382.54
Raiments of the Iron Council: 163.12
Robes of the Umbral Brute: 138.33
Sympathy: 27.56
The Sanctum's Flowing Vestments: 41.38
Valorous Robe of Faith: 1529.5
Valorous Robe of Sanctification: 87.69
Vestments of the Piercing Light: 24.45

I understand that the T7 pieces have a lot of regen, which I need, but I can't believe that it's that much better than Ulduar gear.

For reference, here are my stat weighting values:

MP5: 5.91
SPP: 4.46
Int: 3.83
Haste: 2.45
Spirit: 2.06
Crit: 1.94
Res: 0.51
Stam: 0.2
Health: 0.02

Oh, I didn't realize that set bonuses were already calculated in.  But it seems like that's highly dependant on the chosen role.  The only way I can see this valuation being correct is if it's always assuming a standard holy rotation of spells instead of the selected one (I was using Raid Disc).
Post an issue with this and add on your character.xml file, and I'll take a closer check to see what happens and maybe give an explanation.
Thanks for taking a look - I've entered an issue.
I looked at your issue and I believe it is a result of T7 2 part being valued unreasonably high, it should be fixed for next release.
